description: Verify that the browser behaves correctly after selections are made in the save password dialog box

test_case.title: Purpose
test_case.content:
Verify that when you save a username and password for a particular website,
you can view this information from the preferences panel.

test_case.title: Initial Conditions
test_case.content:
Password manager should be enabled, in a different browser create an account
at a site that requires a username and password such as http://www.ebay.com

test_case.title: Steps/Description
test_case.content:
1. Go to a site that you have not been to before in Netscape 6, such as http://www.ebay.com
  2. Enter your username and password
  3. When a dialog appears asking if you would like to save this information, click yes
  4. From the edit drop down menus, select preference
  5. Click on the arrow next to advanced
  6. Click on passwords
  7. Click View saved passwords
  8. Verify that your saved username and password appear in the list

test_case.title: Expected Results
test_case.content:
4\. Preference pane should open

5\. Advanced options should appear

6\. Password manager options should appear on right pane

7\. A list of saved passwords should appear

reference.title: Goals
reference.content:
Specific items from the [Firefox3/Product Requirements
Document](/Firefox3/Product_Requirements_Document "Firefox3/Product
Requirements Document"):

  * P1 / PASS-001a -- Only let the user save the password after they know the login has succeeded
  * P2 / PASS-001c -- Improve usefulness of password manager
  * P2 / PASS-001d -- Improve discoverability of autofill UI for multiple accounts on the same site
  * P2 / PASS-001e, f -- Improve "Show passwords" window. EG, searching.
  * P2 / PASS-001g -- Simplify and promote the use of Master Password

  
Other (some overlap):

  * Get rid of popup modal dialogs where possible
  * Opportunities to unify UI
  * Make management and use of multiple logins less confusing

**Out of scope** for this pass:

  * P2 / PASS-003a -- Generate random passwords for user
  * Investigate the possibility of authentication-in-chrome for new content authentications schemes to use (OpenID too?)

reference.title: Existing UI Touchpoints
reference.content:
* Authentication provided by user 
    * Master Password popup 
      * Enable/Disable Master Password pref
      * Change Master Password Dialog
    * HTTP authentication popup
    * Proxy authentication popup
    * Form fields in content
  * Controlling what Firefox remembers 
    * Saving user-provided authentication (except Master Password)
    * Blocking Firefox from certain places ("Never for this site")
    * Deleting existing logins 
      * "Show Passwords" window in prefs
      * Shift-delete in an autocomplete field (only when multiple logins exist)
      * "Show Exceptions" window in prefs
    * Clear Private Data 
      * Saved Passwords
      * Authenticated Sessions

reference.title: UI Design / Mockups
reference.content:
(incomplete)

## Notification Bar

  * Replaces modal "Remember Password? Yes/No/Never" with a notification bar (ala popup-blocked notification bar)
  * Replaces "Use Password Mananger to remember this password" checkbox on HTTP auth popup

  * Visual appearance of the notification bar, color, transparency, vertical height?
  * Overlay vs. pushing content down vs. pushing UI up
  * How to dismiss the bar: close button vs. clicking anywhere else (content-only?) vs. forced choice. How to undo?
  * Confirmation of saving/updating the stored password?
  * How to deal with multiple notification bars being requested

## Password Management

  * Allowing filtering list of stored logins
  * Allow editing some fields in-place?
  * Sort list by eTLD
  * The primary column ('hostname') should be JUST the hostname. 
    * ...and port, if non-standard?
    * No 'http[s]://'.
    * ...Leave ftp:// there since it's uncommon (?)
    * ...Create a separate protocol column? And/or a column to indicate secure-only?

## Other

  * Presenting cases where there are multiple logins 
    * For HTTP auth, need a "simple" bugfix to allow using a dropdown in the username field to select from multiple accounts
    * Not sure what more to do with form fields. 
      * Mutate textfield into an editable menubox (so the dropdown widget gives a visual cue)?
      * Autofilling the last-used value (instead of leaving it blank) might help a little bit. Instead of seeing nothing ("firefox is broken") seeing one login might shift you to thinking that it's working, but you somehow can select a different value. OTOH, this is probably just wishful thinking :)
  * Automatic login? We would need to design a second bar that lets users undo the automatic log in

feature: Save username and password, never for this site
description: Verify that the browser behaves correctly after selections are made in the save password dialog box

test_case.title: Purpose
test_case.content:
Verify that the browser behaves correctly after the never for this site
selection is made in the password dialog box.

test_case.title: Initial Conditions
test_case.content: Clear stored passwords or use a sight that you have not been to before

test_case.title: Steps/Description
test_case.content:
1. Go to a sight that requires a password, such as http://www.freeride.com
  2. Enter a username and password and click login
  3. When presented with the save password dialog, click never for this site
  4. Shut down Netscape 6
  5. Open Netscape 6
  6. Return to http://www.freeride.com (or other site, if used)
  7. Enter a username and password and click login

test_case.title: Expected Results
test_case.content:
3\. No password should be saved in Password Manager

6\. The username and password should not be prefilled

7\. The password dialog box should not appear again

reference.title: Goals
reference.content:
Specific items from the [Firefox3/Product Requirements
Document](/Firefox3/Product_Requirements_Document "Firefox3/Product
Requirements Document"):

  * P1 / PASS-001a -- Only let the user save the password after they know the login has succeeded
  * P2 / PASS-001c -- Improve usefulness of password manager
  * P2 / PASS-001d -- Improve discoverability of autofill UI for multiple accounts on the same site
  * P2 / PASS-001e, f -- Improve "Show passwords" window. EG, searching.
  * P2 / PASS-001g -- Simplify and promote the use of Master Password

  
Other (some overlap):

  * Get rid of popup modal dialogs where possible
  * Opportunities to unify UI
  * Make management and use of multiple logins less confusing

**Out of scope** for this pass:

  * P2 / PASS-003a -- Generate random passwords for user
  * Investigate the possibility of authentication-in-chrome for new content authentications schemes to use (OpenID too?)

reference.title: Existing UI Touchpoints
reference.content:
* Authentication provided by user 
    * Master Password popup 
      * Enable/Disable Master Password pref
      * Change Master Password Dialog
    * HTTP authentication popup
    * Proxy authentication popup
    * Form fields in content
  * Controlling what Firefox remembers 
    * Saving user-provided authentication (except Master Password)
    * Blocking Firefox from certain places ("Never for this site")
    * Deleting existing logins 
      * "Show Passwords" window in prefs
      * Shift-delete in an autocomplete field (only when multiple logins exist)
      * "Show Exceptions" window in prefs
    * Clear Private Data 
      * Saved Passwords
      * Authenticated Sessions

reference.title: UI Design / Mockups
reference.content:
(incomplete)

## Notification Bar

  * Replaces modal "Remember Password? Yes/No/Never" with a notification bar (ala popup-blocked notification bar)
  * Replaces "Use Password Mananger to remember this password" checkbox on HTTP auth popup

  * Visual appearance of the notification bar, color, transparency, vertical height?
  * Overlay vs. pushing content down vs. pushing UI up
  * How to dismiss the bar: close button vs. clicking anywhere else (content-only?) vs. forced choice. How to undo?
  * Confirmation of saving/updating the stored password?
  * How to deal with multiple notification bars being requested

## Password Management

  * Allowing filtering list of stored logins
  * Allow editing some fields in-place?
  * Sort list by eTLD
  * The primary column ('hostname') should be JUST the hostname. 
    * ...and port, if non-standard?
    * No 'http[s]://'.
    * ...Leave ftp:// there since it's uncommon (?)
    * ...Create a separate protocol column? And/or a column to indicate secure-only?

## Other

  * Presenting cases where there are multiple logins 
    * For HTTP auth, need a "simple" bugfix to allow using a dropdown in the username field to select from multiple accounts
    * Not sure what more to do with form fields. 
      * Mutate textfield into an editable menubox (so the dropdown widget gives a visual cue)?
      * Autofilling the last-used value (instead of leaving it blank) might help a little bit. Instead of seeing nothing ("firefox is broken") seeing one login might shift you to thinking that it's working, but you somehow can select a different value. OTOH, this is probably just wishful thinking :)
  * Automatic login? We would need to design a second bar that lets users undo the automatic log in

description: Verify that the browser behaves correctly after selections are made in the save password dialog box

test_case.title: Purpose
test_case.content:
Verify that the browser behaves correctly after the no selection is made in
the password dialog box.

test_case.title: Initial Conditions
test_case.content: Clear stored passwords or use a sight that you have not been to before

test_case.title: Steps/Description
test_case.content:
1. Go to a sight that requires a password, such as http://www.freeride.com
  2. Enter a username and password and click login
  3. When presented with the save password dialog, click no
  4. Shut down Netscape 6
  5. Open Netscape 6
  6. Return to http://www.freeride.com (or other site, if used)
  7. Enter a username and password and click login

test_case.title: Expected Results
test_case.content:
3\. No password should be saved in Password Manager

6\. The username and password should not be prefilled

7\. The password dialog box should appear again with choices of yes, never for
this site, and no

reference.title: Goals
reference.content:
Specific items from the [Firefox3/Product Requirements
Document](/Firefox3/Product_Requirements_Document "Firefox3/Product
Requirements Document"):

  * P1 / PASS-001a -- Only let the user save the password after they know the login has succeeded
  * P2 / PASS-001c -- Improve usefulness of password manager
  * P2 / PASS-001d -- Improve discoverability of autofill UI for multiple accounts on the same site
  * P2 / PASS-001e, f -- Improve "Show passwords" window. EG, searching.
  * P2 / PASS-001g -- Simplify and promote the use of Master Password

  
Other (some overlap):

  * Get rid of popup modal dialogs where possible
  * Opportunities to unify UI
  * Make management and use of multiple logins less confusing

**Out of scope** for this pass:

  * P2 / PASS-003a -- Generate random passwords for user
  * Investigate the possibility of authentication-in-chrome for new content authentications schemes to use (OpenID too?)

reference.title: Existing UI Touchpoints
reference.content:
* Authentication provided by user 
    * Master Password popup 
      * Enable/Disable Master Password pref
      * Change Master Password Dialog
    * HTTP authentication popup
    * Proxy authentication popup
    * Form fields in content
  * Controlling what Firefox remembers 
    * Saving user-provided authentication (except Master Password)
    * Blocking Firefox from certain places ("Never for this site")
    * Deleting existing logins 
      * "Show Passwords" window in prefs
      * Shift-delete in an autocomplete field (only when multiple logins exist)
      * "Show Exceptions" window in prefs
    * Clear Private Data 
      * Saved Passwords
      * Authenticated Sessions

reference.title: UI Design / Mockups
reference.content:
(incomplete)

## Notification Bar

  * Replaces modal "Remember Password? Yes/No/Never" with a notification bar (ala popup-blocked notification bar)
  * Replaces "Use Password Mananger to remember this password" checkbox on HTTP auth popup

  * Visual appearance of the notification bar, color, transparency, vertical height?
  * Overlay vs. pushing content down vs. pushing UI up
  * How to dismiss the bar: close button vs. clicking anywhere else (content-only?) vs. forced choice. How to undo?
  * Confirmation of saving/updating the stored password?
  * How to deal with multiple notification bars being requested

## Password Management

  * Allowing filtering list of stored logins
  * Allow editing some fields in-place?
  * Sort list by eTLD
  * The primary column ('hostname') should be JUST the hostname. 
    * ...and port, if non-standard?
    * No 'http[s]://'.
    * ...Leave ftp:// there since it's uncommon (?)
    * ...Create a separate protocol column? And/or a column to indicate secure-only?

## Other

  * Presenting cases where there are multiple logins 
    * For HTTP auth, need a "simple" bugfix to allow using a dropdown in the username field to select from multiple accounts
    * Not sure what more to do with form fields. 
      * Mutate textfield into an editable menubox (so the dropdown widget gives a visual cue)?
      * Autofilling the last-used value (instead of leaving it blank) might help a little bit. Instead of seeing nothing ("firefox is broken") seeing one login might shift you to thinking that it's working, but you somehow can select a different value. OTOH, this is probably just wishful thinking :)
  * Automatic login? We would need to design a second bar that lets users undo the automatic log in

description: Verify that when the password manager has been disabled, it is no longer in use, even for passwords already saved

test_case.title: Purpose
test_case.content:
Verify that when the password manager has been disabled, it is no longer in
use, even for passwords already saved

test_case.title: Initial Conditions
test_case.content:
Browser should be started, password manager should be enabled and you should
have a username and password for a site, such as www.ebay.com

test_case.title: Steps/Description
test_case.content:
1. Go to a sight that requires a password, such as http://www.ebay.com
  2. Enter a username and password and click sign in
  3. You should be presented with a dialog box asking if you would like to save your username and password, click yes
  4. From the Edit drop down list, select preferences
  5. Click the arrow next to advanced
  6. Click passwords
  7. Unclick the box next to Remember passwords for sites that require me to log in
  8. Return to http://www.ebay.com (or other site, if used)

test_case.title: Expected Results
test_case.content:
3\. Your username and password should be saved to the password manager

4\. The preference panel should be displayed

5\. The advanced options should be displayed

6\. The password panel should be displayed on the right hand side

7\. This should disable the password manager

8\. The username and password information should not be prefilled

reference.title: Goals
reference.content:
Specific items from the [Firefox3/Product Requirements
Document](/Firefox3/Product_Requirements_Document "Firefox3/Product
Requirements Document"):

  * P1 / PASS-001a -- Only let the user save the password after they know the login has succeeded
  * P2 / PASS-001c -- Improve usefulness of password manager
  * P2 / PASS-001d -- Improve discoverability of autofill UI for multiple accounts on the same site
  * P2 / PASS-001e, f -- Improve "Show passwords" window. EG, searching.
  * P2 / PASS-001g -- Simplify and promote the use of Master Password

  
Other (some overlap):

  * Get rid of popup modal dialogs where possible
  * Opportunities to unify UI
  * Make management and use of multiple logins less confusing

**Out of scope** for this pass:

  * P2 / PASS-003a -- Generate random passwords for user
  * Investigate the possibility of authentication-in-chrome for new content authentications schemes to use (OpenID too?)

reference.title: Existing UI Touchpoints
reference.content:
* Authentication provided by user 
    * Master Password popup 
      * Enable/Disable Master Password pref
      * Change Master Password Dialog
    * HTTP authentication popup
    * Proxy authentication popup
    * Form fields in content
  * Controlling what Firefox remembers 
    * Saving user-provided authentication (except Master Password)
    * Blocking Firefox from certain places ("Never for this site")
    * Deleting existing logins 
      * "Show Passwords" window in prefs
      * Shift-delete in an autocomplete field (only when multiple logins exist)
      * "Show Exceptions" window in prefs
    * Clear Private Data 
      * Saved Passwords
      * Authenticated Sessions

reference.title: UI Design / Mockups
reference.content:
(incomplete)

## Notification Bar

  * Replaces modal "Remember Password? Yes/No/Never" with a notification bar (ala popup-blocked notification bar)
  * Replaces "Use Password Mananger to remember this password" checkbox on HTTP auth popup

  * Visual appearance of the notification bar, color, transparency, vertical height?
  * Overlay vs. pushing content down vs. pushing UI up
  * How to dismiss the bar: close button vs. clicking anywhere else (content-only?) vs. forced choice. How to undo?
  * Confirmation of saving/updating the stored password?
  * How to deal with multiple notification bars being requested

## Password Management

  * Allowing filtering list of stored logins
  * Allow editing some fields in-place?
  * Sort list by eTLD
  * The primary column ('hostname') should be JUST the hostname. 
    * ...and port, if non-standard?
    * No 'http[s]://'.
    * ...Leave ftp:// there since it's uncommon (?)
    * ...Create a separate protocol column? And/or a column to indicate secure-only?

## Other

  * Presenting cases where there are multiple logins 
    * For HTTP auth, need a "simple" bugfix to allow using a dropdown in the username field to select from multiple accounts
    * Not sure what more to do with form fields. 
      * Mutate textfield into an editable menubox (so the dropdown widget gives a visual cue)?
      * Autofilling the last-used value (instead of leaving it blank) might help a little bit. Instead of seeing nothing ("firefox is broken") seeing one login might shift you to thinking that it's working, but you somehow can select a different value. OTOH, this is probably just wishful thinking :)
  * Automatic login? We would need to design a second bar that lets users undo the automatic log in

description: Verify that when you have saved multiple username's and password's for a website, you are later presented with those same choices

test_case.title: Purpose
test_case.content:
Verify that when you have saved multiple username's and password's for a
website, you are later presented with those same choices

test_case.title: Initial Conditions
test_case.content:
Password manager should be enable and using a different browser, create two
different usernames and passwords for a site such as yahoo
(http://mail.yahoo.com)or another of your choice

test_case.title: Steps/Description
test_case.content:
1. Go to a sight that requires a password, such as http://mail.yahoo.com
  2. Enter a username and password and click sign in
  3. When presented with the save password dialog, click yes
  4. Shut down Netscape 6
  5. Open Netscape 6
  6. Return to http://mail.yahoo.com (or other site, if used)
  7. Delete the prefilled information and enter the second username and password
  8. Click login
  9. When presented with the save password dialog, click yes
  10. Shut down Netscape 6
  11. Open Netscape 6
  12. Return to http://mail.yahoo.com (or other site, if used)
  13. Select one of these choices and click sign in

test_case.title: Expected Results
test_case.content:
3\. The username and password should be saved in Password Manager

6\. The username and password should be prefilled

8\. You should be logged in to the site

9\. The username and password should be saved in Password Manager

12\. You should be presented with a dialog box that offers a choice between
the two usernames

13\. You should be signed in to the site

reference.title: Goals
reference.content:
Specific items from the [Firefox3/Product Requirements
Document](/Firefox3/Product_Requirements_Document "Firefox3/Product
Requirements Document"):

  * P1 / PASS-001a -- Only let the user save the password after they know the login has succeeded
  * P2 / PASS-001c -- Improve usefulness of password manager
  * P2 / PASS-001d -- Improve discoverability of autofill UI for multiple accounts on the same site
  * P2 / PASS-001e, f -- Improve "Show passwords" window. EG, searching.
  * P2 / PASS-001g -- Simplify and promote the use of Master Password

  
Other (some overlap):

  * Get rid of popup modal dialogs where possible
  * Opportunities to unify UI
  * Make management and use of multiple logins less confusing

**Out of scope** for this pass:

  * P2 / PASS-003a -- Generate random passwords for user
  * Investigate the possibility of authentication-in-chrome for new content authentications schemes to use (OpenID too?)

reference.title: Existing UI Touchpoints
reference.content:
* Authentication provided by user 
    * Master Password popup 
      * Enable/Disable Master Password pref
      * Change Master Password Dialog
    * HTTP authentication popup
    * Proxy authentication popup
    * Form fields in content
  * Controlling what Firefox remembers 
    * Saving user-provided authentication (except Master Password)
    * Blocking Firefox from certain places ("Never for this site")
    * Deleting existing logins 
      * "Show Passwords" window in prefs
      * Shift-delete in an autocomplete field (only when multiple logins exist)
      * "Show Exceptions" window in prefs
    * Clear Private Data 
      * Saved Passwords
      * Authenticated Sessions

reference.title: UI Design / Mockups
reference.content:
(incomplete)

## Notification Bar

  * Replaces modal "Remember Password? Yes/No/Never" with a notification bar (ala popup-blocked notification bar)
  * Replaces "Use Password Mananger to remember this password" checkbox on HTTP auth popup

  * Visual appearance of the notification bar, color, transparency, vertical height?
  * Overlay vs. pushing content down vs. pushing UI up
  * How to dismiss the bar: close button vs. clicking anywhere else (content-only?) vs. forced choice. How to undo?
  * Confirmation of saving/updating the stored password?
  * How to deal with multiple notification bars being requested

## Password Management

  * Allowing filtering list of stored logins
  * Allow editing some fields in-place?
  * Sort list by eTLD
  * The primary column ('hostname') should be JUST the hostname. 
    * ...and port, if non-standard?
    * No 'http[s]://'.
    * ...Leave ftp:// there since it's uncommon (?)
    * ...Create a separate protocol column? And/or a column to indicate secure-only?

## Other

  * Presenting cases where there are multiple logins 
    * For HTTP auth, need a "simple" bugfix to allow using a dropdown in the username field to select from multiple accounts
    * Not sure what more to do with form fields. 
      * Mutate textfield into an editable menubox (so the dropdown widget gives a visual cue)?
      * Autofilling the last-used value (instead of leaving it blank) might help a little bit. Instead of seeing nothing ("firefox is broken") seeing one login might shift you to thinking that it's working, but you somehow can select a different value. OTOH, this is probably just wishful thinking :)
  * Automatic login? We would need to design a second bar that lets users undo the automatic log in

description: Verify that when you have saved a username and password for a website and you later change the password, that password manager picks up the new password

test_case.title: Purpose
test_case.content:
Verify that when you have saved a username and password for a website and you
later change the password, that password manager picks up the new password

test_case.title: Initial Conditions
test_case.content:
Password manager should be enable and using a different browser, create a
username and passwords for a site such as lycos (http://my.lycos.com) or
another of your choice

test_case.title: Steps/Description
test_case.content:
1. Go to a sight that requires a password, such as http://my.lycos.com
  2. Enter a username and password and click sign in
  3. When presented with the save password dialog, click yes
  4. Shut down Netscape 6
  5. In a different browser, return to the site and change your password
  6. Open Netscape 6
  7. Return to http://my.lycos.com (or other site, if used)
  8. Delete the prefilled password information and enter the new password
  9. Click login
  10. Shut down Netscape 6
  11. Open Netscape 6
  12. Return to http://my.lycos.com (or other site, if used)
  13. The password and username information should be prefilled, click sign in

test_case.title: Expected Results
test_case.content:
3\. The username and password should be saved in Password Manager

9\. You should be logged in to the site

13\. You should be logged in to the site

9\. The username and password should be saved in Password Manager

12\. You should be presented with a dialog box that offers a choice between
the two usernames

13\. You should be signed in to the site

reference.title: Goals
reference.content:
Specific items from the [Firefox3/Product Requirements
Document](/Firefox3/Product_Requirements_Document "Firefox3/Product
Requirements Document"):

  * P1 / PASS-001a -- Only let the user save the password after they know the login has succeeded
  * P2 / PASS-001c -- Improve usefulness of password manager
  * P2 / PASS-001d -- Improve discoverability of autofill UI for multiple accounts on the same site
  * P2 / PASS-001e, f -- Improve "Show passwords" window. EG, searching.
  * P2 / PASS-001g -- Simplify and promote the use of Master Password

  
Other (some overlap):

  * Get rid of popup modal dialogs where possible
  * Opportunities to unify UI
  * Make management and use of multiple logins less confusing

**Out of scope** for this pass:

  * P2 / PASS-003a -- Generate random passwords for user
  * Investigate the possibility of authentication-in-chrome for new content authentications schemes to use (OpenID too?)

reference.title: Existing UI Touchpoints
reference.content:
* Authentication provided by user 
    * Master Password popup 
      * Enable/Disable Master Password pref
      * Change Master Password Dialog
    * HTTP authentication popup
    * Proxy authentication popup
    * Form fields in content
  * Controlling what Firefox remembers 
    * Saving user-provided authentication (except Master Password)
    * Blocking Firefox from certain places ("Never for this site")
    * Deleting existing logins 
      * "Show Passwords" window in prefs
      * Shift-delete in an autocomplete field (only when multiple logins exist)
      * "Show Exceptions" window in prefs
    * Clear Private Data 
      * Saved Passwords
      * Authenticated Sessions

reference.title: UI Design / Mockups
reference.content:
(incomplete)

## Notification Bar

  * Replaces modal "Remember Password? Yes/No/Never" with a notification bar (ala popup-blocked notification bar)
  * Replaces "Use Password Mananger to remember this password" checkbox on HTTP auth popup

  * Visual appearance of the notification bar, color, transparency, vertical height?
  * Overlay vs. pushing content down vs. pushing UI up
  * How to dismiss the bar: close button vs. clicking anywhere else (content-only?) vs. forced choice. How to undo?
  * Confirmation of saving/updating the stored password?
  * How to deal with multiple notification bars being requested

## Password Management

  * Allowing filtering list of stored logins
  * Allow editing some fields in-place?
  * Sort list by eTLD
  * The primary column ('hostname') should be JUST the hostname. 
    * ...and port, if non-standard?
    * No 'http[s]://'.
    * ...Leave ftp:// there since it's uncommon (?)
    * ...Create a separate protocol column? And/or a column to indicate secure-only?

## Other

  * Presenting cases where there are multiple logins 
    * For HTTP auth, need a "simple" bugfix to allow using a dropdown in the username field to select from multiple accounts
    * Not sure what more to do with form fields. 
      * Mutate textfield into an editable menubox (so the dropdown widget gives a visual cue)?
      * Autofilling the last-used value (instead of leaving it blank) might help a little bit. Instead of seeing nothing ("firefox is broken") seeing one login might shift you to thinking that it's working, but you somehow can select a different value. OTOH, this is probably just wishful thinking :)
  * Automatic login? We would need to design a second bar that lets users undo the automatic log in

description: Verify that when you disable password manager from the preferences panel, you no longer are asked if you would like to save passwords and longer get prefilled info on sites

test_case.title: Purpose
test_case.content:
Verify that when you disable password manager from the preferences panel, you
no longer are asked if you would like to save passwords and longer get
prefilled info on sites

test_case.title: Initial Conditions
test_case.content:
Browser should be started and you should have a username and password for a
site, such as www.freeride.com

test_case.title: Steps/Description
test_case.content:
1. From the Edit drop down list, select preferences
  2. Click the arrow next to advanced
  3. Click passwords
  4. Unclick the box next to remember passwords for sites that require me to log in
  5. Click ok
  6. Go to a sight that requires a password, such as http://www.freeride.com
  7. Enter a username and password and click sign in

test_case.title: Expected Results
test_case.content:
1\. The preference panel should be displayed

2\. The advanced options should be displayed

3\. The password panel should be displayed on the right hand side

5\. The preferences panel should close

7\. You should not be presented with a dialog asking if you would like to save
your username and password

reference.title: Goals
reference.content:
Specific items from the [Firefox3/Product Requirements
Document](/Firefox3/Product_Requirements_Document "Firefox3/Product
Requirements Document"):

  * P1 / PASS-001a -- Only let the user save the password after they know the login has succeeded
  * P2 / PASS-001c -- Improve usefulness of password manager
  * P2 / PASS-001d -- Improve discoverability of autofill UI for multiple accounts on the same site
  * P2 / PASS-001e, f -- Improve "Show passwords" window. EG, searching.
  * P2 / PASS-001g -- Simplify and promote the use of Master Password

  
Other (some overlap):

  * Get rid of popup modal dialogs where possible
  * Opportunities to unify UI
  * Make management and use of multiple logins less confusing

**Out of scope** for this pass:

  * P2 / PASS-003a -- Generate random passwords for user
  * Investigate the possibility of authentication-in-chrome for new content authentications schemes to use (OpenID too?)

reference.title: Existing UI Touchpoints
reference.content:
* Authentication provided by user 
    * Master Password popup 
      * Enable/Disable Master Password pref
      * Change Master Password Dialog
    * HTTP authentication popup
    * Proxy authentication popup
    * Form fields in content
  * Controlling what Firefox remembers 
    * Saving user-provided authentication (except Master Password)
    * Blocking Firefox from certain places ("Never for this site")
    * Deleting existing logins 
      * "Show Passwords" window in prefs
      * Shift-delete in an autocomplete field (only when multiple logins exist)
      * "Show Exceptions" window in prefs
    * Clear Private Data 
      * Saved Passwords
      * Authenticated Sessions

reference.title: UI Design / Mockups
reference.content:
(incomplete)

## Notification Bar

  * Replaces modal "Remember Password? Yes/No/Never" with a notification bar (ala popup-blocked notification bar)
  * Replaces "Use Password Mananger to remember this password" checkbox on HTTP auth popup

  * Visual appearance of the notification bar, color, transparency, vertical height?
  * Overlay vs. pushing content down vs. pushing UI up
  * How to dismiss the bar: close button vs. clicking anywhere else (content-only?) vs. forced choice. How to undo?
  * Confirmation of saving/updating the stored password?
  * How to deal with multiple notification bars being requested

## Password Management

  * Allowing filtering list of stored logins
  * Allow editing some fields in-place?
  * Sort list by eTLD
  * The primary column ('hostname') should be JUST the hostname. 
    * ...and port, if non-standard?
    * No 'http[s]://'.
    * ...Leave ftp:// there since it's uncommon (?)
    * ...Create a separate protocol column? And/or a column to indicate secure-only?

## Other

  * Presenting cases where there are multiple logins 
    * For HTTP auth, need a "simple" bugfix to allow using a dropdown in the username field to select from multiple accounts
    * Not sure what more to do with form fields. 
      * Mutate textfield into an editable menubox (so the dropdown widget gives a visual cue)?
      * Autofilling the last-used value (instead of leaving it blank) might help a little bit. Instead of seeing nothing ("firefox is broken") seeing one login might shift you to thinking that it's working, but you somehow can select a different value. OTOH, this is probably just wishful thinking :)
  * Automatic login? We would need to design a second bar that lets users undo the automatic log in

test_case.title: Purpose
test_case.content:
Verify that when you enable password manager from the preferences panel, you
are asked if you would like to save usernames and passwords and get prefilled
info on sites

test_case.title: Initial Conditions
test_case.content:
Browser should be started and you should have a username and password for a
site, such as www.ebay.com

test_case.title: Steps/Description
test_case.content:
1. From the Edit drop down list, select preferences
  2. Click the arrow next to advanced
  3. Click passwords
  4. Click the box next to remember passwords for sites that require me to log in
  5. Click ok
  6. Go to a sight that requires a password, such as http://www.ebay.com
  7. Enter a username and password and click sign in
  8. You should be presented with a dialog box asking if you would like to save your username and password, click yes

test_case.title: Expected Results
test_case.content:
1\. The preference panel should be displayed

2\. The advanced options should be displayed

3\. The password panel should be displayed on the right hand side

5\. The preferences panel should close

7\. You should be signed into the sight and the username and password
information should be saved in the password manager

reference.title: Goals
reference.content:
Specific items from the [Firefox3/Product Requirements
Document](/Firefox3/Product_Requirements_Document "Firefox3/Product
Requirements Document"):

  * P1 / PASS-001a -- Only let the user save the password after they know the login has succeeded
  * P2 / PASS-001c -- Improve usefulness of password manager
  * P2 / PASS-001d -- Improve discoverability of autofill UI for multiple accounts on the same site
  * P2 / PASS-001e, f -- Improve "Show passwords" window. EG, searching.
  * P2 / PASS-001g -- Simplify and promote the use of Master Password

  
Other (some overlap):

  * Get rid of popup modal dialogs where possible
  * Opportunities to unify UI
  * Make management and use of multiple logins less confusing

**Out of scope** for this pass:

  * P2 / PASS-003a -- Generate random passwords for user
  * Investigate the possibility of authentication-in-chrome for new content authentications schemes to use (OpenID too?)

reference.title: Existing UI Touchpoints
reference.content:
* Authentication provided by user 
    * Master Password popup 
      * Enable/Disable Master Password pref
      * Change Master Password Dialog
    * HTTP authentication popup
    * Proxy authentication popup
    * Form fields in content
  * Controlling what Firefox remembers 
    * Saving user-provided authentication (except Master Password)
    * Blocking Firefox from certain places ("Never for this site")
    * Deleting existing logins 
      * "Show Passwords" window in prefs
      * Shift-delete in an autocomplete field (only when multiple logins exist)
      * "Show Exceptions" window in prefs
    * Clear Private Data 
      * Saved Passwords
      * Authenticated Sessions

reference.title: UI Design / Mockups
reference.content:
(incomplete)

## Notification Bar

  * Replaces modal "Remember Password? Yes/No/Never" with a notification bar (ala popup-blocked notification bar)
  * Replaces "Use Password Mananger to remember this password" checkbox on HTTP auth popup

  * Visual appearance of the notification bar, color, transparency, vertical height?
  * Overlay vs. pushing content down vs. pushing UI up
  * How to dismiss the bar: close button vs. clicking anywhere else (content-only?) vs. forced choice. How to undo?
  * Confirmation of saving/updating the stored password?
  * How to deal with multiple notification bars being requested

## Password Management

  * Allowing filtering list of stored logins
  * Allow editing some fields in-place?
  * Sort list by eTLD
  * The primary column ('hostname') should be JUST the hostname. 
    * ...and port, if non-standard?
    * No 'http[s]://'.
    * ...Leave ftp:// there since it's uncommon (?)
    * ...Create a separate protocol column? And/or a column to indicate secure-only?

## Other

  * Presenting cases where there are multiple logins 
    * For HTTP auth, need a "simple" bugfix to allow using a dropdown in the username field to select from multiple accounts
    * Not sure what more to do with form fields. 
      * Mutate textfield into an editable menubox (so the dropdown widget gives a visual cue)?
      * Autofilling the last-used value (instead of leaving it blank) might help a little bit. Instead of seeing nothing ("firefox is broken") seeing one login might shift you to thinking that it's working, but you somehow can select a different value. OTOH, this is probably just wishful thinking :)
  * Automatic login? We would need to design a second bar that lets users undo the automatic log in

description: Verify that when you have saved a username and password in password manager, this information can be viewed in the password manager through preferences

test_case.title: Purpose
test_case.content:
Verify that when you save a username and password for a particular website,
you can view this information from the preferences panel .

test_case.title: Initial Conditions
test_case.content:
Password manager should be enabled, in a different browser create an account
at a site that requires a username and password such as http://www.ebay.com

test_case.title: Steps/Description
test_case.content:
1. Go to a site that you have not been to before in Netscape 6, such as http://www.ebay.com
  2. Enter your username and password
  3. When a dialog appears asking if you would like to save this information, click yes
  4. From the edit drop down menus, select preference
  5. Click on the arrow next to advanced
  6. Click on passwords
  7. Click View saved passwords
  8. Verify that your saved username and password appear in the list

test_case.title: Expected Results
test_case.content:
4\. Preference pane should open

5\. Advanced options should appear

6\. Password manager options should appear on right pane

7\. A list of saved passwords should appear

Document](/Firefox3/Product_Requirements_Document "Firefox3/Product
Requirements Document"):

  * P1 / PASS-001a -- Only let the user save the password after they know the login has succeeded
  * P2 / PASS-001c -- Improve usefulness of password manager
  * P2 / PASS-001d -- Improve discoverability of autofill UI for multiple accounts on the same site
  * P2 / PASS-001e, f -- Improve "Show passwords" window. EG, searching.
  * P2 / PASS-001g -- Simplify and promote the use of Master Password

  
Other (some overlap):

  * Get rid of popup modal dialogs where possible
  * Opportunities to unify UI
  * Make management and use of multiple logins less confusing

**Out of scope** for this pass:

  * P2 / PASS-003a -- Generate random passwords for user
  * Investigate the possibility of authentication-in-chrome for new content authentications schemes to use (OpenID too?)

reference.title: Existing UI Touchpoints
reference.content:
* Authentication provided by user 
    * Master Password popup 
      * Enable/Disable Master Password pref
      * Change Master Password Dialog
    * HTTP authentication popup
    * Proxy authentication popup
    * Form fields in content
  * Controlling what Firefox remembers 
    * Saving user-provided authentication (except Master Password)
    * Blocking Firefox from certain places ("Never for this site")
    * Deleting existing logins 
      * "Show Passwords" window in prefs
      * Shift-delete in an autocomplete field (only when multiple logins exist)
      * "Show Exceptions" window in prefs
    * Clear Private Data 
      * Saved Passwords
      * Authenticated Sessions

reference.title: UI Design / Mockups
reference.content:
(incomplete)

## Notification Bar

  * Replaces modal "Remember Password? Yes/No/Never" with a notification bar (ala popup-blocked notification bar)
  * Replaces "Use Password Mananger to remember this password" checkbox on HTTP auth popup

  * Visual appearance of the notification bar, color, transparency, vertical height?
  * Overlay vs. pushing content down vs. pushing UI up
  * How to dismiss the bar: close button vs. clicking anywhere else (content-only?) vs. forced choice. How to undo?
  * Confirmation of saving/updating the stored password?
  * How to deal with multiple notification bars being requested

## Password Management

  * Allowing filtering list of stored logins
  * Allow editing some fields in-place?
  * Sort list by eTLD
  * The primary column ('hostname') should be JUST the hostname. 
    * ...and port, if non-standard?
    * No 'http[s]://'.
    * ...Leave ftp:// there since it's uncommon (?)
    * ...Create a separate protocol column? And/or a column to indicate secure-only?

## Other

  * Presenting cases where there are multiple logins 
    * For HTTP auth, need a "simple" bugfix to allow using a dropdown in the username field to select from multiple accounts
    * Not sure what more to do with form fields. 
      * Mutate textfield into an editable menubox (so the dropdown widget gives a visual cue)?
      * Autofilling the last-used value (instead of leaving it blank) might help a little bit. Instead of seeing nothing ("firefox is broken") seeing one login might shift you to thinking that it's working, but you somehow can select a different value. OTOH, this is probably just wishful thinking :)
  * Automatic login? We would need to design a second bar that lets users undo the automatic log in

description: Verify that when you have designated not to ever save a username and password in password manager, this information can be viewed in the password manager through preferences (expedia.com)

test_case.title: Purpose
test_case.content:
Verify that when you have designated not to ever save a username and password
in password manager, this information can be viewed in the password manager
through preferences

test_case.title: Initial Conditions
test_case.content:
Browser should be started, password manager should be enabled and you should
have a username and password for a site, such as http://www.expedia.com

test_case.title: Steps/Description
test_case.content:
1. Go to a sight that requires a password, such as http://www.expedia.com
  2. Enter a username and password and click sign in to expedia.com
  3. You should be presented with a dialog box asking if you would like to save your username and password, click never for this site
  4. From the Edit drop down list, select preferences
  5. Click the arrow next to advanced
  6. Click passwords
  7. Click the view stored passwords button
  8. Click the Passwords never saved tab
  9. Repeat for several different sites

test_case.title: Expected Results
test_case.content:
3\. This site should be saved in the passwords Never Saved portion of password
manager

4\. The preference panel should be displayed

5\. The advanced options should be displayed

6\. The password panel should be displayed on the right hand side

7\. The password manager box should come up with the passwords saved tab in
front

8\. You should see www.expedia.com listed

reference.title: Goals
reference.content:
Specific items from the [Firefox3/Product Requirements
Document](/Firefox3/Product_Requirements_Document "Firefox3/Product
Requirements Document"):

  * P1 / PASS-001a -- Only let the user save the password after they know the login has succeeded
  * P2 / PASS-001c -- Improve usefulness of password manager
  * P2 / PASS-001d -- Improve discoverability of autofill UI for multiple accounts on the same site
  * P2 / PASS-001e, f -- Improve "Show passwords" window. EG, searching.
  * P2 / PASS-001g -- Simplify and promote the use of Master Password

  
Other (some overlap):

  * Get rid of popup modal dialogs where possible
  * Opportunities to unify UI
  * Make management and use of multiple logins less confusing

**Out of scope** for this pass:

  * P2 / PASS-003a -- Generate random passwords for user
  * Investigate the possibility of authentication-in-chrome for new content authentications schemes to use (OpenID too?)

reference.title: Existing UI Touchpoints
reference.content:
* Authentication provided by user 
    * Master Password popup 
      * Enable/Disable Master Password pref
      * Change Master Password Dialog
    * HTTP authentication popup
    * Proxy authentication popup
    * Form fields in content
  * Controlling what Firefox remembers 
    * Saving user-provided authentication (except Master Password)
    * Blocking Firefox from certain places ("Never for this site")
    * Deleting existing logins 
      * "Show Passwords" window in prefs
      * Shift-delete in an autocomplete field (only when multiple logins exist)
      * "Show Exceptions" window in prefs
    * Clear Private Data 
      * Saved Passwords
      * Authenticated Sessions

reference.title: UI Design / Mockups
reference.content:
(incomplete)

## Notification Bar

  * Replaces modal "Remember Password? Yes/No/Never" with a notification bar (ala popup-blocked notification bar)
  * Replaces "Use Password Mananger to remember this password" checkbox on HTTP auth popup

  * Visual appearance of the notification bar, color, transparency, vertical height?
  * Overlay vs. pushing content down vs. pushing UI up
  * How to dismiss the bar: close button vs. clicking anywhere else (content-only?) vs. forced choice. How to undo?
  * Confirmation of saving/updating the stored password?
  * How to deal with multiple notification bars being requested

## Password Management

  * Allowing filtering list of stored logins
  * Allow editing some fields in-place?
  * Sort list by eTLD
  * The primary column ('hostname') should be JUST the hostname. 
    * ...and port, if non-standard?
    * No 'http[s]://'.
    * ...Leave ftp:// there since it's uncommon (?)
    * ...Create a separate protocol column? And/or a column to indicate secure-only?

## Other

  * Presenting cases where there are multiple logins 
    * For HTTP auth, need a "simple" bugfix to allow using a dropdown in the username field to select from multiple accounts
    * Not sure what more to do with form fields. 
      * Mutate textfield into an editable menubox (so the dropdown widget gives a visual cue)?
      * Autofilling the last-used value (instead of leaving it blank) might help a little bit. Instead of seeing nothing ("firefox is broken") seeing one login might shift you to thinking that it's working, but you somehow can select a different value. OTOH, this is probably just wishful thinking :)
  * Automatic login? We would need to design a second bar that lets users undo the automatic log in

description: Verify that you can remove a username and password for a given site and it will no longer autofill on that sight nor will it be listed in password manager (espn.com)

test_case.title: Purpose
test_case.content:
Verify that you can remove a username and password for a given site and it
will no longer autofill on that sight nor will it be listed in password
manager

test_case.title: Initial Conditions
test_case.content:
Password manager should be enabled, in a different browser create an account
at a site that requires a username and password such as http://www.espn.com

test_case.title: Steps/Description
test_case.content:
1. Go to a site that you have not been to before in Netscape 6, such as http://www.espn.com
  2. Enter your username and password
  3. When a dialog appears asking if you would like to save this information, click yes
  4. From the edit drop down menus, select preference
  5. Click on the arrow next to advanced
  6. Click on passwords
  7. Click View saved passwords
  8. Highlight this sight and username in the list and click remove
  9. Click cancel
  10. Click View saved passwords
  11. Highlight this sight and username in the list and click remove
  12. Click ok
  13. Click View saved passwords

test_case.title: Expected Results
test_case.content:
3\. Your username and password should be saved to the password manager

4\. Preference pane should open

5\. Advanced options should appear

6\. Password manager options should appear on right pane

7\. A list of saved passwords should appear with your saved sight and username
appearing in the list

8\. This site's information should no longer appear in the list

9\. Window should close

10\. This site should once again, be in the list of saved passwords

11\. This site and username should no longer appear on the list of saved
passwords

13\. This site should be removed from the list

reference.title: Goals
reference.content:
Specific items from the [Firefox3/Product Requirements
Document](/Firefox3/Product_Requirements_Document "Firefox3/Product
Requirements Document"):

  * P1 / PASS-001a -- Only let the user save the password after they know the login has succeeded
  * P2 / PASS-001c -- Improve usefulness of password manager
  * P2 / PASS-001d -- Improve discoverability of autofill UI for multiple accounts on the same site
  * P2 / PASS-001e, f -- Improve "Show passwords" window. EG, searching.
  * P2 / PASS-001g -- Simplify and promote the use of Master Password

  
Other (some overlap):

  * Get rid of popup modal dialogs where possible
  * Opportunities to unify UI
  * Make management and use of multiple logins less confusing

**Out of scope** for this pass:

  * P2 / PASS-003a -- Generate random passwords for user
  * Investigate the possibility of authentication-in-chrome for new content authentications schemes to use (OpenID too?)

reference.title: Existing UI Touchpoints
reference.content:
* Authentication provided by user 
    * Master Password popup 
      * Enable/Disable Master Password pref
      * Change Master Password Dialog
    * HTTP authentication popup
    * Proxy authentication popup
    * Form fields in content
  * Controlling what Firefox remembers 
    * Saving user-provided authentication (except Master Password)
    * Blocking Firefox from certain places ("Never for this site")
    * Deleting existing logins 
      * "Show Passwords" window in prefs
      * Shift-delete in an autocomplete field (only when multiple logins exist)
      * "Show Exceptions" window in prefs
    * Clear Private Data 
      * Saved Passwords
      * Authenticated Sessions

reference.title: UI Design / Mockups
reference.content:
(incomplete)

## Notification Bar

  * Replaces modal "Remember Password? Yes/No/Never" with a notification bar (ala popup-blocked notification bar)
  * Replaces "Use Password Mananger to remember this password" checkbox on HTTP auth popup

  * Visual appearance of the notification bar, color, transparency, vertical height?
  * Overlay vs. pushing content down vs. pushing UI up
  * How to dismiss the bar: close button vs. clicking anywhere else (content-only?) vs. forced choice. How to undo?
  * Confirmation of saving/updating the stored password?
  * How to deal with multiple notification bars being requested

## Password Management

  * Allowing filtering list of stored logins
  * Allow editing some fields in-place?
  * Sort list by eTLD
  * The primary column ('hostname') should be JUST the hostname. 
    * ...and port, if non-standard?
    * No 'http[s]://'.
    * ...Leave ftp:// there since it's uncommon (?)
    * ...Create a separate protocol column? And/or a column to indicate secure-only?

## Other

  * Presenting cases where there are multiple logins 
    * For HTTP auth, need a "simple" bugfix to allow using a dropdown in the username field to select from multiple accounts
    * Not sure what more to do with form fields. 
      * Mutate textfield into an editable menubox (so the dropdown widget gives a visual cue)?
      * Autofilling the last-used value (instead of leaving it blank) might help a little bit. Instead of seeing nothing ("firefox is broken") seeing one login might shift you to thinking that it's working, but you somehow can select a different value. OTOH, this is probably just wishful thinking :)
  * Automatic login? We would need to design a second bar that lets users undo the automatic log in

description: Verify that you can remove all username and password information and it will no longer autofill nor will anything be listed in password manager

test_case.title: Purpose
test_case.content:
Verify that you can remove all username and password information and it will
no longer autofill nor will anything be listed in password manager

test_case.title: Initial Conditions
test_case.content:
Password manager should be enabled and you should have saved username and
password information for several sites

test_case.title: Steps/Description
test_case.content:
1. From the edit drop down menus, select preference
  2. Click on the arrow next to advanced
  3. Click on passwords
  4. Click View stored passwords
  5. Click remove all
  6. Click cancel
  7. Click View saved passwords
  8. Click remove all
  9. Click ok
  10. Click View saved passwords

test_case.title: Expected Results
test_case.content:
1\. Preference pane should open

2\. Advanced options should appear

3\. Password manager options should appear on right pane

4\. A list of saved passwords should appear with your saved sights and
usernames appearing in the list

5\. All of the saved site and username information should be removed from the
list

7\. All of the saved site and username information should again, appear in the
list

8\. All of the saved site and username information should be removed from the
list

10\. There should be no information listed under the passwords saved tab

11\. This site and username should no longer appear on the list of saved
passwords

13\. This site should be removed from the list

reference.title: Goals
reference.content:
Specific items from the [Firefox3/Product Requirements
Document](/Firefox3/Product_Requirements_Document "Firefox3/Product
Requirements Document"):

  * P1 / PASS-001a -- Only let the user save the password after they know the login has succeeded
  * P2 / PASS-001c -- Improve usefulness of password manager
  * P2 / PASS-001d -- Improve discoverability of autofill UI for multiple accounts on the same site
  * P2 / PASS-001e, f -- Improve "Show passwords" window. EG, searching.
  * P2 / PASS-001g -- Simplify and promote the use of Master Password

  
Other (some overlap):

  * Get rid of popup modal dialogs where possible
  * Opportunities to unify UI
  * Make management and use of multiple logins less confusing

**Out of scope** for this pass:

  * P2 / PASS-003a -- Generate random passwords for user
  * Investigate the possibility of authentication-in-chrome for new content authentications schemes to use (OpenID too?)

reference.title: Existing UI Touchpoints
reference.content:
* Authentication provided by user 
    * Master Password popup 
      * Enable/Disable Master Password pref
      * Change Master Password Dialog
    * HTTP authentication popup
    * Proxy authentication popup
    * Form fields in content
  * Controlling what Firefox remembers 
    * Saving user-provided authentication (except Master Password)
    * Blocking Firefox from certain places ("Never for this site")
    * Deleting existing logins 
      * "Show Passwords" window in prefs
      * Shift-delete in an autocomplete field (only when multiple logins exist)
      * "Show Exceptions" window in prefs
    * Clear Private Data 
      * Saved Passwords
      * Authenticated Sessions

reference.title: UI Design / Mockups
reference.content:
(incomplete)

## Notification Bar

  * Replaces modal "Remember Password? Yes/No/Never" with a notification bar (ala popup-blocked notification bar)
  * Replaces "Use Password Mananger to remember this password" checkbox on HTTP auth popup

  * Visual appearance of the notification bar, color, transparency, vertical height?
  * Overlay vs. pushing content down vs. pushing UI up
  * How to dismiss the bar: close button vs. clicking anywhere else (content-only?) vs. forced choice. How to undo?
  * Confirmation of saving/updating the stored password?
  * How to deal with multiple notification bars being requested

## Password Management

  * Allowing filtering list of stored logins
  * Allow editing some fields in-place?
  * Sort list by eTLD
  * The primary column ('hostname') should be JUST the hostname. 
    * ...and port, if non-standard?
    * No 'http[s]://'.
    * ...Leave ftp:// there since it's uncommon (?)
    * ...Create a separate protocol column? And/or a column to indicate secure-only?

## Other

  * Presenting cases where there are multiple logins 
    * For HTTP auth, need a "simple" bugfix to allow using a dropdown in the username field to select from multiple accounts
    * Not sure what more to do with form fields. 
      * Mutate textfield into an editable menubox (so the dropdown widget gives a visual cue)?
      * Autofilling the last-used value (instead of leaving it blank) might help a little bit. Instead of seeing nothing ("firefox is broken") seeing one login might shift you to thinking that it's working, but you somehow can select a different value. OTOH, this is probably just wishful thinking :)
  * Automatic login? We would need to design a second bar that lets users undo the automatic log in

description: Verify that you can remove a site and username from the passwords never saved section of password manager (ivillage.com)

test_case.title: Purpose
test_case.content:
Verify that you can remove a site and username from the passwords never saved
section of password manager

test_case.title: Initial Conditions
test_case.content:
Password manager should be enabled, in a different browser create an account
at a site that requires a username and password such as
http://www.ivillage.com

test_case.title: Steps/Description
test_case.content:
1. Go to a site that you have not been to before in Netscape 6, such as http://www.ivillage.com
  2. Enter your username and password
  3. When a dialog appears asking if you would like to save this information, click never for this site
  4. From the edit drop down menus, select preference
  5. Click on the arrow next to advanced
  6. Click on passwords
  7. Click View stored passwords
  8. Click on the passwords never saved tab
  9. Highlight this sight and username in the list and click remove
  10. Click cancel
  11. Click View saved passwords
  12. Click the passwords never saved tab
  13. Highlight this sight and username in the list and click remove
  14. Click ok
  15. Click View stored passwords
  16. Click Passwords never saved tab

test_case.title: Expected Results
test_case.content:
3\. Your username and password should be saved to the passwords never saved
portion of password manager

4\. Preference pane should open

5\. Advanced options should appear

6\. Password manager options should appear on right pane

7\. A list of saved passwords should appear with your saved sight and username
appearing in the list

8\. The site and username for this site should be listed under the passwords
never saved tab

9\. This site's information should no longer appear in the list

10\. Window should close

12\. This site and username should again appear on the list

13\. This site and username should no longer appear on the list of never saved
passwords

14\. This site should be removed from the list

16\. This site and username should not appear on the passwords never saved
list.

reference.title: Goals
reference.content:
Specific items from the [Firefox3/Product Requirements
Document](/Firefox3/Product_Requirements_Document "Firefox3/Product
Requirements Document"):

  * P1 / PASS-001a -- Only let the user save the password after they know the login has succeeded
  * P2 / PASS-001c -- Improve usefulness of password manager
  * P2 / PASS-001d -- Improve discoverability of autofill UI for multiple accounts on the same site
  * P2 / PASS-001e, f -- Improve "Show passwords" window. EG, searching.
  * P2 / PASS-001g -- Simplify and promote the use of Master Password

  
Other (some overlap):

  * Get rid of popup modal dialogs where possible
  * Opportunities to unify UI
  * Make management and use of multiple logins less confusing

**Out of scope** for this pass:

  * P2 / PASS-003a -- Generate random passwords for user
  * Investigate the possibility of authentication-in-chrome for new content authentications schemes to use (OpenID too?)

reference.title: Existing UI Touchpoints
reference.content:
* Authentication provided by user 
    * Master Password popup 
      * Enable/Disable Master Password pref
      * Change Master Password Dialog
    * HTTP authentication popup
    * Proxy authentication popup
    * Form fields in content
  * Controlling what Firefox remembers 
    * Saving user-provided authentication (except Master Password)
    * Blocking Firefox from certain places ("Never for this site")
    * Deleting existing logins 
      * "Show Passwords" window in prefs
      * Shift-delete in an autocomplete field (only when multiple logins exist)
      * "Show Exceptions" window in prefs
    * Clear Private Data 
      * Saved Passwords
      * Authenticated Sessions

reference.title: UI Design / Mockups
reference.content:
(incomplete)

## Notification Bar

  * Replaces modal "Remember Password? Yes/No/Never" with a notification bar (ala popup-blocked notification bar)
  * Replaces "Use Password Mananger to remember this password" checkbox on HTTP auth popup

  * Visual appearance of the notification bar, color, transparency, vertical height?
  * Overlay vs. pushing content down vs. pushing UI up
  * How to dismiss the bar: close button vs. clicking anywhere else (content-only?) vs. forced choice. How to undo?
  * Confirmation of saving/updating the stored password?
  * How to deal with multiple notification bars being requested

## Password Management

  * Allowing filtering list of stored logins
  * Allow editing some fields in-place?
  * Sort list by eTLD
  * The primary column ('hostname') should be JUST the hostname. 
    * ...and port, if non-standard?
    * No 'http[s]://'.
    * ...Leave ftp:// there since it's uncommon (?)
    * ...Create a separate protocol column? And/or a column to indicate secure-only?

## Other

  * Presenting cases where there are multiple logins 
    * For HTTP auth, need a "simple" bugfix to allow using a dropdown in the username field to select from multiple accounts
    * Not sure what more to do with form fields. 
      * Mutate textfield into an editable menubox (so the dropdown widget gives a visual cue)?
      * Autofilling the last-used value (instead of leaving it blank) might help a little bit. Instead of seeing nothing ("firefox is broken") seeing one login might shift you to thinking that it's working, but you somehow can select a different value. OTOH, this is probably just wishful thinking :)
  * Automatic login? We would need to design a second bar that lets users undo the automatic log in

feature: Preferences, passwords never saved, remove all
description: Verify that you can remove all site and username information from the passwords never saved section of password manager (ivillage.com)

test_case.title: Purpose
test_case.content:
Verify that you can remove a site and username from the passwords never saved
section of password manager

test_case.title: Initial Conditions
test_case.content:
Password manager should be enabled, in a different browser create an account
at a site that requires a username and password such as
http://www.ivillage.com

test_case.title: Steps/Description
test_case.content:
1. Go to a site that you have not been to before in Netscape 6, such as http://www.ivillage.com
  2. Enter your username and password
  3. When a dialog appears asking if you would like to save this information, click never for this site
  4. From the edit drop down menus, select preference
  5. Click on the arrow next to advanced
  6. Click on passwords
  7. Click View stored passwords
  8. Click on the passwords never saved tab
  9. Highlight this sight and username in the list and click remove
  10. Click cancel
  11. Click View saved passwords
  12. Click the passwords never saved tab
  13. Highlight this sight and username in the list and click remove
  14. Click ok
  15. Click View stored passwords
  16. Click Passwords never saved tab

test_case.title: Expected Results
test_case.content:
3\. Your username and password should be saved to the passwords never saved
portion of password manager

4\. Preference pane should open

5\. Advanced options should appear

6\. Password manager options should appear on right pane

7\. A list of saved passwords should appear with your saved sight and username
appearing in the list

8\. The site and username for this site should be listed under the passwords
never saved tab

9\. This site's information should no longer appear in the list

10\. Window should close

12\. This site and username should again appear on the list

13\. This site and username should no longer appear on the list of never saved
passwords

14\. This site should be removed from the list

16\. This site and username should not appear on the passwords never saved
list.

reference.title: Goals
reference.content:
Specific items from the [Firefox3/Product Requirements
Document](/Firefox3/Product_Requirements_Document "Firefox3/Product
Requirements Document"):

  * P1 / PASS-001a -- Only let the user save the password after they know the login has succeeded
  * P2 / PASS-001c -- Improve usefulness of password manager
  * P2 / PASS-001d -- Improve discoverability of autofill UI for multiple accounts on the same site
  * P2 / PASS-001e, f -- Improve "Show passwords" window. EG, searching.
  * P2 / PASS-001g -- Simplify and promote the use of Master Password

  
Other (some overlap):

  * Get rid of popup modal dialogs where possible
  * Opportunities to unify UI
  * Make management and use of multiple logins less confusing

**Out of scope** for this pass:

  * P2 / PASS-003a -- Generate random passwords for user
  * Investigate the possibility of authentication-in-chrome for new content authentications schemes to use (OpenID too?)

reference.title: Existing UI Touchpoints
reference.content:
* Authentication provided by user 
    * Master Password popup 
      * Enable/Disable Master Password pref
      * Change Master Password Dialog
    * HTTP authentication popup
    * Proxy authentication popup
    * Form fields in content
  * Controlling what Firefox remembers 
    * Saving user-provided authentication (except Master Password)
    * Blocking Firefox from certain places ("Never for this site")
    * Deleting existing logins 
      * "Show Passwords" window in prefs
      * Shift-delete in an autocomplete field (only when multiple logins exist)
      * "Show Exceptions" window in prefs
    * Clear Private Data 
      * Saved Passwords
      * Authenticated Sessions

reference.title: UI Design / Mockups
reference.content:
(incomplete)

## Notification Bar

  * Replaces modal "Remember Password? Yes/No/Never" with a notification bar (ala popup-blocked notification bar)
  * Replaces "Use Password Mananger to remember this password" checkbox on HTTP auth popup

  * Visual appearance of the notification bar, color, transparency, vertical height?
  * Overlay vs. pushing content down vs. pushing UI up
  * How to dismiss the bar: close button vs. clicking anywhere else (content-only?) vs. forced choice. How to undo?
  * Confirmation of saving/updating the stored password?
  * How to deal with multiple notification bars being requested

## Password Management

  * Allowing filtering list of stored logins
  * Allow editing some fields in-place?
  * Sort list by eTLD
  * The primary column ('hostname') should be JUST the hostname. 
    * ...and port, if non-standard?
    * No 'http[s]://'.
    * ...Leave ftp:// there since it's uncommon (?)
    * ...Create a separate protocol column? And/or a column to indicate secure-only?

## Other

  * Presenting cases where there are multiple logins 
    * For HTTP auth, need a "simple" bugfix to allow using a dropdown in the username field to select from multiple accounts
    * Not sure what more to do with form fields. 
      * Mutate textfield into an editable menubox (so the dropdown widget gives a visual cue)?
      * Autofilling the last-used value (instead of leaving it blank) might help a little bit. Instead of seeing nothing ("firefox is broken") seeing one login might shift you to thinking that it's working, but you somehow can select a different value. OTOH, this is probably just wishful thinking :)
  * Automatic login? We would need to design a second bar that lets users undo the automatic log in

description: Verify that when you have saved a username and password in password manager, this information can be viewed in the password manager through tasks

test_case.title: Purpose
test_case.content:
Verify that when you have saved a username and password in password manager,
this information can be viewed in the password manager through tasks

test_case.title: Initial Conditions
test_case.content:
Browser should be started, password manager should be enabled and you should
have a username and password for a site, such as www.excite.com

test_case.title: Steps/Description
test_case.content:
1. Go to a sight that requires a password, such as http://www.excite.com
  2. Enter a username and password and click sign in
  3. You should be presented with a dialog box asking if you would like to save your username and password, click yes
  4. From the Tasks drop down list, select privacy and security->password manager->view stored passworrds

test_case.title: Expected Results
test_case.content:
3\. Your username and password should be saved to the password manager

4\. The password manager box should come up with the passwords saved tab in
front and you should see your saved information listed below

From MozillaWiki

reference.title: Goals
reference.content:
Specific items from the [Firefox3/Product Requirements
Document](/Firefox3/Product_Requirements_Document "Firefox3/Product
Requirements Document"):

  * P1 / PASS-001a -- Only let the user save the password after they know the login has succeeded
  * P2 / PASS-001c -- Improve usefulness of password manager
  * P2 / PASS-001d -- Improve discoverability of autofill UI for multiple accounts on the same site
  * P2 / PASS-001e, f -- Improve "Show passwords" window. EG, searching.
  * P2 / PASS-001g -- Simplify and promote the use of Master Password

  
Other (some overlap):

  * Get rid of popup modal dialogs where possible
  * Opportunities to unify UI
  * Make management and use of multiple logins less confusing

**Out of scope** for this pass:

  * P2 / PASS-003a -- Generate random passwords for user
  * Investigate the possibility of authentication-in-chrome for new content authentications schemes to use (OpenID too?)

reference.title: Existing UI Touchpoints
reference.content:
* Authentication provided by user 
    * Master Password popup 
      * Enable/Disable Master Password pref
      * Change Master Password Dialog
    * HTTP authentication popup
    * Proxy authentication popup
    * Form fields in content
  * Controlling what Firefox remembers 
    * Saving user-provided authentication (except Master Password)
    * Blocking Firefox from certain places ("Never for this site")
    * Deleting existing logins 
      * "Show Passwords" window in prefs
      * Shift-delete in an autocomplete field (only when multiple logins exist)
      * "Show Exceptions" window in prefs
    * Clear Private Data 
      * Saved Passwords
      * Authenticated Sessions

reference.title: UI Design / Mockups
reference.content:
(incomplete)

## Notification Bar

  * Replaces modal "Remember Password? Yes/No/Never" with a notification bar (ala popup-blocked notification bar)
  * Replaces "Use Password Mananger to remember this password" checkbox on HTTP auth popup

  * Visual appearance of the notification bar, color, transparency, vertical height?
  * Overlay vs. pushing content down vs. pushing UI up
  * How to dismiss the bar: close button vs. clicking anywhere else (content-only?) vs. forced choice. How to undo?
  * Confirmation of saving/updating the stored password?
  * How to deal with multiple notification bars being requested

## Password Management

  * Allowing filtering list of stored logins
  * Allow editing some fields in-place?
  * Sort list by eTLD
  * The primary column ('hostname') should be JUST the hostname. 
    * ...and port, if non-standard?
    * No 'http[s]://'.
    * ...Leave ftp:// there since it's uncommon (?)
    * ...Create a separate protocol column? And/or a column to indicate secure-only?

## Other

  * Presenting cases where there are multiple logins 
    * For HTTP auth, need a "simple" bugfix to allow using a dropdown in the username field to select from multiple accounts
    * Not sure what more to do with form fields. 
      * Mutate textfield into an editable menubox (so the dropdown widget gives a visual cue)?
      * Autofilling the last-used value (instead of leaving it blank) might help a little bit. Instead of seeing nothing ("firefox is broken") seeing one login might shift you to thinking that it's working, but you somehow can select a different value. OTOH, this is probably just wishful thinking :)
  * Automatic login? We would need to design a second bar that lets users undo the automatic log in

description: Verify that when you have designated not to ever save a username and password in password manager, this information can be viewed in the password manager through tasks (nbci.com)

test_case.title: Purpose
test_case.content:
Verify that when you have designated not to ever save a username and password
in password manager, this information can be viewed in the password manager
through tasks

test_case.title: Initial Conditions
test_case.content:
Browser should be started, password manager should be enabled and you should
have a username and password for a site, such as http://www.nbci.com

test_case.title: Steps/Description
test_case.content:
1. Go to a sight that requires a password, such as http://www.nbci.com
  2. Enter a username and password and click sign in to nbci.com
  3. You should be presented with a dialog box asking if you would like to save your username and password, click never for this site
  4. From the Tasks drop down list, select privacy and security->password manager->View stored passwords
  5. Click the passwords never saved tab
  6. Click passwords
  7. Click the view stored passwords button
  8. Click the Passwords never saved tab
  9. Repeat for several different sites

test_case.title: Expected Results
test_case.content:
3\. This site should be saved in the passwords Never Saved portion of password
manager

4 The password manager box should come up with the passwords saved tab in
front

5\. You should see www.nbci.com listed
